text: What Happened to Jones is a lostThe Library of Congress American Silent Feature Film Survival Catalog: What Happened to Jones 1920 American silent comedy film directed by James Cruze and starring Bryant Washburn. It was based on the 1897 play What Happened to Jones by George Broadhurst. It was produced by Famous Players-Lasky and distributed by Paramount/Artcraft. The AFI Catalog of Feature Films: What Happened to Jones ==Cast== *Bryant Washburn as Jimmie Jones *Margaret Loomis as Cissy Smith *J. Maurice Foster as Bobbie Brown *Frank Jonasson as Anthony Goodley *Lillian Leighton as Matilda Brown *Caroline Rankin as Alvina Smith *Richard Cummings as Green ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1920 films Category:American silent feature films Category:American films Category:Lost American films Category:American films based on plays Category:Paramount Pictures films Category:Films directed by James Cruze Category:American black-and-white films Category:1920 comedy films
title: What Happened to Jones (1920 film)
